About Me

Hi, I am Jincheng! I am a Dickson instructor in the Department of Mathematics at The University of Chicago. I completed my Ph.D. in Mathematics at The University of Texas at Austin in March 2022, under the supervision of Prof. Caffarelli and Prof. Vasseur. My research interests include analysis, partial differential equations, fluid dynamics, especially the incompressible Euler equation and the Navier-Stokes equation. I received my bachelor’s degree at Xi’an Jiaotong University, where I was also a student in the Special Class for the Gifted Young before my undergraduate study.

This year, I co-organize the Calderón-Zygmund Analysis Seminar at UChicago.
